intro: Asperula bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate woodruff, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant features small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Asperula bracteata is typically found in woodland areas and thrives in partial shade.
